content: little stories cowl with thanks this beautiful pattern is dedicated to jess roth jess is a photographer and the owner of little stories studios she deserves a cowl named after her because she is such a wonderful friend and has been there for me on occasions too often to mention jess thanks for being you <3 you can visit little stories studio online at www littlestoriesstudio com au last but not least a big thanks to sam bennett for being my pattern editor pattern notes this pattern is written in us terms and is designed to be flexible ­ you can use any type of yarn ­ use a hook size to your choosing for a firmer cowl a smaller hook is recommended a larger hook will give you more of a drapey and delicate result ch3 counts as first double_crochet throughout copyright c crochet wench 2020 copyright protects this publication the pattern can not be reproduced in any way without my written consent items made with this pattern can be sold if you share your items on social media we ask for a pattern link or designer credit thank you for understanding #crochetwench #littlestoriescowl version control version 1 0 2 pattern tester information sam bennett sam used a cotton kings twister delux for her cowl she started with 164 chains to get more length with the finer yarn sam used a 3 5mm hook tania barry tania used lion brand heartland in colourway glacier bay she used 1 ball of 100g tania used a 6 00mm hook julie jules julie used bwm bloom 8 ply for her cowl she used 88g julie used a 4 00mm hook colleen o neill colleen used spotlight value ball 10 ply in a mustard color colleen used a 8 00mm hook 3 stitch information magic_ring magic_ring chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet cross stitch 3 double_crochet cross stitch pic3 3 chain picot pic5 5 chain picot stitch notes cross stitch ­ when doing a cross stitch skip one stitch double_crochet into next 2 stitches put the 3rd double_crochet back into the missed stitch when working over a chain space the first double_crochet goes ino the chain space second into the next double_crochet then the last stitch is back over to the stitch you missed before the chain space 4 part 1 ­ cowl pattern chain 140 increase in multiples of 24 for a longer cowl or scarf row 3 ­ cross stitch across to last stitch double_crochet 1 into last stitch row 1 ­ double_crochet into 5th chain from hook chain 1 and turn double_crochet each stitch across 2 double_crochet 45 cross stitches chain 1 and turn 137 double_crochet repeat row 2 and 3 until cowl is the desired width row 2 ­ single_crochet into each stitch across chain 3 and turn 137 single_crochet 5 enlarged chart 6 part 2 ­ the border row 1 ­ single_crochet into each stitch across row 7 ­ note chain 1 spaces count as a stitch on
